xierpa3.toolbox.session package¶

xierpa3.toolbox.session.session module¶

class xierpa3.toolbox.session.session.Session(key, timestamp, limit=None, name=None, user=None, keep=False, protected=False)¶
C¶

alias of Constants

allExist(fields, matchvalues=[None])¶
anyExists(fields, matchvalues=[None])¶
append(form)¶
asString()¶
cleanUp()¶

Clean up the session for objects that can’t be cpickled: 1. parsed node trees with weakrefs cannot be cpickled;

python v 2.4 raises a TypeError instead of pickle.UnpickleableError, so catch this exception

>>> from xpyth.xmlparser import XMLParser
>>> parsed_xml = XMLParser().parse('<a><b>c</b></a>')
>>> parsed_xml
<a No parent >
>>> s = Session('1234')
>>> s.set('nodewithweakparent', parsed_xml)
<a No parent >
clear()¶

<doc> The <code>clear</code> method clears all session data, while keeping the instance working. This e.g. can be used when the user is logging out, and all previous data should be cleared. </doc>

default(field, value)¶

<doc> The <code>default</code> method sets the value of <attr>field</attr> to <attr>value</attr> only if the current value is <code>None</code>. This way the method can be used to compact initialize the value of a session field. </doc>

xierpa3.toolbox.session.sessionmanager module¶

class xierpa3.toolbox.session.sessionmanager.SessionManager¶

Bases: dict

C¶

alias of Constants

garbageCollect(force=False)¶
getExpire(sid)¶

<doc> The <code>getExpire</code> method answers amount of seconds before the session <attr>sid</attr> will expire. Answer <code>0</code> is the session cannot be found. </doc>

getLoggedUserIds(applicationname)¶

<doc> The <code>getLoggedUserIds</code> method answers the list of ids for all users that are logged in with non-expired sessions that have <attr>applicationname</attr>. </doc>

classmethod getNewSessionId(size=None)¶

<doc> The <code>getNewSessionId</code> method answers a new generated session id of length <attr>size</attr> of <code>self.SESSION_SIDDIGITS</code> if omitted. </doc>

getSession(sid, limit=None, name=None, user=None, keep=False, protected=False)¶

<doc> The <code>getSession</code> method answers the <code>Session</code> instance with <attr>sid</attr>. Answer a new instance if the <attr>sid</attr> cannot be found. Store that session in the dict of <code>self</code>. </doc>

getSessionById(applicationname, sid)¶

<doc> The <code>getSessionById</code> method answers the session the is defined by <attr>applicationname</attr> and <attr>sid</attr>. Answer <code>None</code> if the session cannot be found. </doc>

getTimeStamps()¶

<doc> The <code>getTimeStamps</code> method answers a list with the timestamps of all existing session. The <code>self.garbageCollect</code> method is called to cleanup expired sessions once in a while. This is done before the collection of current time stamps is performed. </doc>

newSession()¶

<doc> The <code>getNewSession</code> method answers a new session. </doc>

classmethod newTimeStamp()¶

<doc> The <code>newTimeStamp</code> method answers a uniquelong, so there the total number is always unique. The result is a 18-digit long that will fit inside a Postgres bigint, instead of a relational id. </doc>

refresh(sid)¶

<doc> The <code>refresh</code> method refreshes the timestamp of session <attr>sid</attr>. Ignore the call if the session cannot be found. </doc>
